Description: Bare head of Thomas Young, facing left. (obverse)
A sun disc dividing two crowned snakes which support an ankh; four further ankhs below, sun disc and scarab below. (reverse)
Bibliographic references: Brown 1980 / A catalogue of British historical medals 1760-1960, vol.I: the accession of George III to the death of William IV (p.328:1341)
Exhibition history: 2022-2023 13 Oct-19 Feb, London, BM, G30, Hieroglyphics: Unlocking Ancient Egypt
Associated names: Named in inscription & portrayed: Dr Thomas Young
Named in inscription: Green, Frederick William
